snippet.title: Duke of Edinburgh Timeline
snippet.content: A TIMELINE OF THE DUKE OF EDINBURGH'S LINKS TO AUSTRALIA * 1940 - In Royal Navy aboard battleship Ramilles escorting Australian soldiers from Melbourne to Suez. * 1945 - Travels to Australia on board Royal Navy aboard destroyer Whelp as part of the British Pacific Fleet, escorting damaged carrier Illustrious to Sydney before Whelp's refit in Melbourne. * 1954 - Accompanied the Queen on her first tour of Australia across NSW, ACT, Tasmania, Victoria, Qld, SA and WA over eight weeks. Many years later there were reports of a royal tiff while on a weekend retreat in Healesville, Vic, with film of the incident destroyed; the event was recreated in Netflix series The Crown. * November 1956 - Duke of Edinburgh opens Olympic Games in Melbourne, also visits NT, Canberra, NSW and Victoria. * 1961 - As an avid bird-watcher, Prince Philip's interest in the re-discovery of the noisy scrub-bird in WA eventually led to the dedication of the Two Peoples Bay Nature Reserve for its conservation in 1967. * 1962 - Prince Philip opened the Commonwealth (Empire) Games in Perth as part of a tour to WA, NSW, ACT * 1963 - Accompanied the Queen on a tour across Australia taking in Canberra, SA, Vic, Tasmania, Sydney, Brisbane, NT and WA. * 1965 - The prince opened the Royal Australian Mint in February while visiting NSW and the ACT. * 1967 Prince Philip helped organise the third Commonwealth Study Conference to be held in May 1968. He visited the ACT, Victoria and Tasmania, where he toured fire-ravaged areas from Black Tuesday. * 1968 - Opened the Duke of Edinburgh Study Conference, also visiting the Northern Territory, Victoria, New South Wales, the ACT and Tasmania. * 1970 - Accompanied the Queen on part of her tour for the Captain Cook Bicentenary including the inauguration of the Captain Cook Memorial in Canberra. * October 1973 - Opening of the Sydney Opera House by the Queen * February 1974 - The Prince joins the Queen for the opening of parliament in Canberra. The Queen's wider Australian tour was cancelled due to a general election in the UK but completed by Prince Philip. * March 1977 - Accompanied the Queen as part of celebrations for her Silver Jubilee, visiting Canberra, Brisbane, NSW and Melbourne. * May 1980 Accompanied the Queen to open the High Court Building in Canberra, also visited Sydney and Melbourne. * September-October 1981 Royal couple attend CHOGM in Melbourne, also visited Hobart and Adelaide. * September-October 1982 Prince Philip opened the Commonwealth Games in Brisbane and was later joined by the Queen for the closing of the Games .The couple then visited Sydney and Canberra for the opening of the Australian National Gallery. * March 1986 - Visited Canberra, Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide. * April-May 1988 - Australia's bicentenary celebrations included a visit to Kalgoorlie in WA, Anzac Day services in Hobart, and events in Longreach, opening World Expo 88 in Brisbane, Darling Harbour in Sydney, and the new Parliament house in Canberra. * February 1992 - 150th anniversary of the City of Sydney, the royal couple also visited Dubbo, Canberra and Adelaide. * March-April 2000 - Royal couple on 16-day tour across Australia. Prince Philip gave a speech at the World Fellowship Reception in Sydney and visited an Outward Bound adventure camp near Canberra, but caused some consternation while touring a cheese factory in the NSW city of Wagga Wagga when he failed to don a protective cap and coat. He also quizzed teenage yachtsman Jesse Martin about his 11-month round-the-world voyage. * March 2002 - Royal visit for CHOGM in Brisbane at Coolum, with a visit to Cairns where Prince Philip asked an Aboriginal tribal leader if they still threw spears at one another - a comment later defended by ATSIC. Prince Philip travelled alone to Roma to open tourist attraction The Big Rig. * March 2006 - Accompanied the Queen when she opened the new Colonnade at the Sydney Opera House, then visited Canberra, where Philip toured the CSIRO before HM opened the Melbourne Commonwealth Games on March 15. * October 2011 - Accompanied the Queen to Canberra, Brisbane, Melbourne and Perth where HM opened CHOGM on October 28. * January 2015 Prime Minister Tony Abbott controversially announced Prince Philip would be awarded a Knight of the Order of Australia. (C) AAP 2017
